1fRxBX2baFi3A7ALTH7zAw.text: I have to admit that this place was even over my expectation. I had no idea that it is so nice. I will go there again to taste the traditional delicious dishes. One good advantage is that the interior is really pleasant too, a lot of wood is used and it creates a really cosy atmosphere.

3tkk1hvhqvcr0bAcoHaFJw.text: Very good place. Friendly staff and great food. The classic burger was amazing. The servers bothered to give me samples of different british beers to try.

aRrR-7rkE1TbFquxsL2ZUA.text: After a shortish walk in London's latest attempt at warm weather, we find ourselves at the Chop House, a rather posh looking thames-side eaterie that does a sneaky lunch offer (£22 for 2 courses, £26 for 3). Originally I was quite dubious - happily the food made up for any feelings of being underdressed for the occasion. This is lunch done properly, with a great view of Tower Bridge if you get the outside tables. Both my courses were delicious, and the staff kindly accomodated my sauce/dressing on the side requests (I ate Poached Pear and Rocket salad, followed by trout and purple sprouting broccoli). The portion sizes are decent enough, thank goodness, for me to feel full up after clearing my plate two courses in a row - none of that big plate / tiny morsel rubbish here. For occasional dining, or a discreet treat, I would be happy to return. Note: there's a 12.5% service charge automatically added to the bill (cheeky!), bear that in mind when you look at the prices.

sDJIsJG3Ne1Nd2g5E6qAjw.text: Decent value on a 3 course for £20 deal. Best aspect of the restaurant is the view though. Tower Bridge lit up at night, right outside your table, is magical, and it was a great place to bring a friend visiting from out of town. Service was pleasant, if not speedy, and we were at a table tucked around the corner from the rest of the dining room so it wasn't as loud as being in the main area. Would definitely come back in the summer to snag an outdoor table. Favorite dish of the night (and I'm someone who doesn't usually like desserts): sticky toffee pudding.

r6gPK30wpLontZo8FbNR0A.text: The location of the Chop House is fantastic. But over the years, the quality of the food has declined. Three years ago I would have given them 4.5 out of 5 On Sunday at lunch, my starter of chicken liver pâté was so cold that it was more like a chicken liver lolly ice. Difficult to spread on the toast, and that cold, difficult to taste. When I mentioned this to the waiter, he kind of grunted and carried on. The main of roast beef and yorkshire pudding was lacking as well. Great gravy, but the beef was fatty. The yorkshire pud was so hard that you could have rowed across to the Tower of London in it. Gordon Ramsay's Yorkshire pud wins hands down ;) The carrots and red cabbage were very nice.

azVOto056_beYebJKBPisg.text: Been there 2 times. First time we had a very good lunch and desserts as well. Second time went with 2 friends for a Sunday lunch and it was a disaster. I sent my steak back (badly cooked) and the prices for the second time was not worth at all. I am not sure if I can rate it as good or bad place really.. Packed both times and kinda expensive.

5R3qGgWVZXPJVzqwdRUbdA.text: Good food, location and environment with nice service.  A good evening place to stroll and dine.

QhitkArdpgI6t2WG-1h32w.text: The Butler's Wharf Chop House is situated in the Butler's Wharf development, Shad Thames. Situated on the river front it makes a lovely picturesque lunch or dinner out whether it is 20 degrees outside or two.Clean,minimal decor with wood throughout it has an almost boaty feel to it.The food, the most important part, is excellent. With a fabulous menu which is cooked in an open kitchen. Something for every palette although not good for vegetarians as the name suggests.pleasant staff, although a little over bearing at times and a nice family atmosphere. Can dress up or dress down. Fairly expensive but definitely worth it.

1NfuEXERiJxhO3ladWPMng.text: I went here a few weeks ago and it was a refreshing change to eat British food in Britain! If you are tight for cash they often have a set menu for a set price, but if you're not worried about money then just dive in! With all your favourite homely dishes like lamb, steak and fish and chips, you will feel like you're at home (probably a more posh version though). As I'm pretty picky with wine, a wine specialist was able to find a perfect bottle that fitted by specification completely! You will need side's as well if you like you're grub, as it's a bit on the small side. Overall I enjoyed my dining experience - simple food cooked well, garnished with a lovely service.

GX-6AJ1U2fcNm3QotSXpuQ.text: Went here as part of London Resturant week with the 3 course dinner for £25.00. Booked through lastminute.com so was a bit worried about if the booking had gone through and it was a first dat so didn't really need any more stress but Ph'd them the day before and after getting through on the 3rd try was greeted with a friendly voice who confirmed the booking and upgraded us to a booth.Rocked up on the night and was imediatelly impressed by the quick and efficient greeting by the waiter in the bar who instead of just pointing us in the direction of the resturant showed us personally and took our coats to the free coat check as well.The view out over tower bridge was magic and waitress was quickly with us to offer a choice of free breads to snack on while we looked over the set menu to make our choice of some mouth watering dishes (I had had a light lunch so was quite hungry). Wine selection was good but remember to look in the back for wine by the glass as everything else is by the bottle.Staters came out and instead of looking like something just warmed up they looked and tasted great. empty plates where wisked away and after a short and enjoyable break to let the starters settle the mains came out and were fantastic.We both had the slow roasted pork on mash and while it would have been a bit small if we didn't have starters it was enough to fill us up. Pudding was tasty and well presented and once again the service was attentive without being over the top. They sent us on our way with a cheery wave and helped with the coats. Would definitely go back over summer and make the most of the outside terrace and great service.

1PW0IcWmS7y7C5tX6hxbiw.text: only go here if you are desperate or just want a drink with a view. the food was not good. my boyfriend was not well the day after we ate here.

d8jtfdfgJqxTLIm5-M1PwA.text: We took advantage of the restaurant week two courses for 14.99 deal. It was a great location with lovely views. The food was very nice and enjoyed by all. The reception staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome but the waiting staff we not very attentive and took a long time to come to us. Great value for money though.

R-7Ve6qH70WBK3wLFdkhPw.text: Again I am a guy who likes deals, the toptable deals that offers 2 courses and a glass of English wine all for £10, available from Monday to Saturday from 6.30pm to 10.30pm. Located in an awesome building by the river, the place is stunning. And £10 for a dinner , it can never get any cheaper. I had beef stew for main course and White and dark chocolate mousse for dessert. It was good for the price and the location. No complains and I would recommend to people who love deals.

OBAVnVJX_QOP7ddNaezzvQ.text: Went on Saturday for lunch with some friends and it has to be said it was very good. My rib of beef was excellent and the portions very generous. It isn't cheap but I think the food is worth the price. We had an excellent bottle of Chateau Neuf du Pape but they did know how to charge for it. The wine list could of done with some more affordable choices. The service was a little hap hazard at times. A lot of waiters and managers but not a great deal of organization. I will definitely be going back.

NnJRIu43ChDiyItddYhaNA.text: Very nice view on Tower Bridge. The outside terasse is especially nice on fresh summer evenings. The food is very good, mostly British classics. Service was perfect, attentive but discreet.

IKjXm55zdo4GAl4-DUJH_g.text: We sat in the bar. The Butler's Wharf Chop House is set on the Thames with a lovely view of the Tower Bridge. Here's the 3 reasons why it gets a 2-star review:1. Slow service. We waited possibly 15 minutes or more before a waiter asked if we wanted drinks. The drinks showed up 10 minutes later. We had to hunt a waitress down to take our order. Then sat in front of our empty dinner plates for at least 15 mins. I finally bussed them myself. 2. Scotch Rump Steak - fat and gristle, but prepared medium rare and mustard butter; best mushy peas with fresh, meaty, lightly fried fish. Chips were think and mostly crispy.3. The restaurant is located on the Thames with a lovely view of the Tower Bridge

XTbVj7q8siY8ufHiPvw2kw.text: Would give 0 stars if I could. Rude maitre D. She stated she could not seat us at 9pm on a weekend when it was clear they were not busy. Stated we needed a reservation. We had our first day in London and looking forward to this place from past reviews . From NYC and this would not fly there . Stay away . Way too pretentious for a fish and chip joint .

pKnsal4MV8dMMPhIgna_vA.text: Sat there ordered food and drinks. After 25 min not only they didn't bring our drinks or water, the server said they had run out of steak and didn't even try to offer anything instead. Very bad service. Don't support such restaurant that don't care about customers.

a8OsHINxinuvetFSOS2wfg.text: This place is still pretty solid, but before this week my last visit 15 years ago was even better. Very good service, good (but not as great as it once was) food & a fine atmosphere especially for those seated facing the Thames & Tower Bridge... a truly stunning & memorable view.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. View from right outside... amazing!

-bQlO_bFEpb4rNc_jeq65g.text: Great restaurant. What's better than coming out of the Design Museum, having a table outside overlooking the Tower Bridge (See pictures for more detail). The Cosmo was perfect. The Pork Chop was fatty and juicy, and the service was good. I'm a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Cosmo over Tower Bridge
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Pork Chop

acuzjGfWnCIdxxQSEln0Cw.text: What a fun place with an amazing view! The service was really good too - we had to hurry to a show and they accommodated us nicely - the manager was even kind enough to bring us paper cups to pour our leftover wine in so we can take it with us walking to the show! what a great night! Thanks B.W.!!!  Oh yea, the food was great - get the Mussels!

z7OzCH_M-ab7VK--YEn_3w.text: I've had a handful of meals at Butler's Wharf. They are enjoyable, not the most amazing food, but decent food.  What I really love about this restaurant is the location and layout of the restaurant itself.  There's just something about eating traditional British food and looking out over the Thames and Tower Bridge.

1z42KVh-53uOKr8AyN3qOw.text: Ended up at the bar area with a London Evening Standard menu.  The bar area is really non-descript and there is no real view from that area of the restaurant.  The service was poor.  Had to hail down the waiter to take drink orders and while we lingered post dinner for at least an hour, there was no one coming to ask us if we wanted drinks or refilling a water glass.The food wasn't great (note that I was using the salt shaker and pepper shaker on both my appetizer and the main).  It was fine--nothing was wrong with it and my salmon was cooked well (although would have been nice to have known I was getting a salmon steak and not a filet) but it was very boring with a couple of roast potatoes on the side.  I think this area has some good eats, so do your best to find somewhere else a bit more exciting.

oSQPZu5OB7JSVAJPefOwTQ.text: Swank restaurant with a lovely view along the river Thames. It has a good selection of English seafood and meat specialties with classic sides like mushy peas and Yorkshire pudding. The service was some of the best we had in London, which overall wasn't up to US standards. Expansive view of the Tower Bridge.  This would be a good special occasion restaurant, or for business meetings. A little on the expensive side for everyday.

NFxkUPaKfoErLX3UfA9O-g.text: The view is the best part about this restaurant.  Even though we were sitting inside, we still got a pretty good view of the Tower Bridge lit up on a Friday night.We came as a group of 4 for the whole suckling pig.  It was great presentation - when the roast pig came out, all carved and arranged on a couple of chopping boards, I was impressed.  The meat has a stronger flavour than pork I have had at other restaurants.  I had expected thicker crackling, but that but may just be the nature of the pig that we got.The sides were disappointing - the veges were definitely overdone.The service was patchy.  While our server was friendly, he was a little inexperienced with taking the right order.  The bill was also incorrect and it was a hassle to pay only a partial tip.  At the end of it all, we just paid no tip so we could leave.

ypCsBd82sUIJxzrbBNDv3Q.text: We had our work's Christmas party here, so there were about 40 people in our group. The restaurant offered a great view of the Thames and Tower Bridge, a real plus given the visiting American and European colleagues in our party. The menu is traditional British cuisine. Overall the food was slightly disappointing, those of us who ordered the beef and Yorkshire pudding were confronted with poor quality beef. However the smoked salmon starter was delicious. The service was poor with one of our tables lagging behind the other three. Overall the best feature of this restaurant was the view, the food given the price was disappointing.

7vuLVibFkhJlL2DPf_BvgA.text: Based on location alone, Butler's Wharf Chop House could get five stars. London things don't get much more iconic than al-fresco dining with Tower Bridge as a majestic backdrop.Food is good too, and staff is friendly. Next to the "chops" there are usually some good fish dishes. Everything is slick. Staff is friendly and efficient. All is fine. Fine, not exceptional and for prices charged at Chop House one may expect something else. Neighbouring restaurants like La Pont De La Tour (belonging to the same group) offer an altogether different experience. Yet that's doesn't keep me from coming to Chop House. For a nice casual dining experience it is good and reliable. Ideal to have a quick bite after a long week at work. I've also taken large groups to Chop House a few times to wide acclaim.One tip, try to get a table in the bar area. It might not be as fancy but food prices are much more reasonable and the food is pretty much the same.

w24uDLyrQxIagDgiF7RpSg.text: Great restaurant! Been here already few times with friends and family, with each visit I was happier that I've came to the right place. You have to book a table a day or two before coming here, since there's a lot of 'traffic', but thats understandable, since the place is great. Staff are really good at what they are doing, always so professional, polite and welcoming. There's a wide selection of starters, mains, deserts and drinks in the menu to choose from and everything seems to be prices reasonably.Recommended!

QKEPvpD-q1rvPq77YS8t5g.text: Wandered into this restaurant with my husband and 2 boys (ages 7 & 10) after a long day of checking out the sites. The food was great. Leo and Alessandra were very attentive and made accommodations to be sure that are children were equally as satisfied.

tpMcQPjY2vS57n1HYeCavg.text: For those that haven't been, I've uploaded a picture of the view from the tables on the riverside. Location is everything when it comes to eating out, and this place probably has one of the best in town. The menu is fairly middle-range price wise for London and the food is pretty good. They do a decent range of shellfish and i went for some Oysters to start - very nice, but couldn't do more than 6. For those that want the ambience without the budget, they do a set menu for around £20-£30. If you want the a la carte the whole affair with wine is probably going to be anywhere from £60-£80 a head. However they have a VERY large wine list so you can really splash out here if you're so inclined. There are two dining areas - the restaurant or the bar. From what I could see the restaurant had tablecloths, but the menu is pretty much the same and the bar has outside seating with the same view. If you're after some food without the fuss, go to the bar. If you want to spend a whole evening book into the restaurant. I was told it wasn't possible to book the outside seating, so I guess this is an incentive to arrive early and nab a good seat. The clientele (from what I could see) was mainly bankers with their doll-like estuary girlfriends, but don't let that put you off as they're not total horays. Nice staff though, who were pretty slick once we were sat down.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom

o0PiwemK4QllJCnixGkFag.text: Our experience here was great!! You have great views of the tower bridge, even from inside of the restaurant. We were in the upper level. I believe they have a bar downstairs. The service was impeccable!! It's a little on the pricier side, however good food and great service with an awesome view makes it worth the money!

nl15Opw2Zdm0LdNloEjPvA.text: Delicious is the right word to say here!!!! The guy on the reception was so smiling and polite. The choose a wonderful table for me. Every single piece of  food was so tasty, will go there again and bring my friends there to try it

FDQNzShS-nQYVkBARHATeQ.text: I had the most amazing experience here last year and would have given it a 5 star as everything was so perfect, food, service, view, ambiance. Unfortunately I tripped back there again a couple of weeks ago and felt that the service wasn't so good. There was a little confusion as to whether we were booked or not and ended up sitting at the bar for a while which I suppose wasn't too bad considering we had champagne cocktails. We ended up eating in the bar side of the restaurant so that we could secure a table outside and when the food came it couldn't be faulted. The service may I add was also faultless from this point onwardsWe had oysters, salmon, steak, all presented well and full of flavour. Its not the cheapest place to eat, but I guess that the type of food I like will never be that cheap in London...... Around about £50-£60 per head and wine generally starts at about £25 for the cheaper range (Large wine list) This is my sort of place to eat in London and with it's positioning, who could ask for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. View from our table

pcWb4uVqjxbFcTqjJ2eJ_A.text: Nice place with lovely staff. The menu is nicely arranged and contains some very interesting and unique items. There is also a nice variety in the wine list and it's not even that expensive. The tables are comfortable and there's also the option of hosting events with lots of people.

UAXd-_a5HNNsv67j5iipGQ.text: Dined early from the value Bar menu. 2 or 3 courses for £12 or £15 each in menu prix fixe.Smoothie drinks available too. Delicious courses of ling on samphire with shallots.Puds were a rhubarb pastry triumph. Bread/butter arrived promptly and there was attentive, professional service throughout. Also highly recommended better furnished main restaurant with a full menu for the hungry and discerning. Beautiful views from the Bar in the sunlit dusk of spring.

7ZlwjMUOU66Eq1dvEJLj2Q.text: Happy Birthday to Me! Decided to make reservations here in advance after walking around Tower of London and noticed the amazing outdoor patio dining area with heated lamps. We walked in, had a drink and planned to come back in a few days.Unfortunately, our plans of dining outside were disappointed as the hostess informed us the patio was closed due to cold weather even though the tables were set and the heaters were running. Instead of cancelling our reservation we decided to stay for dinner and happy we did. Our meals alone, stood on it's own merit and while we still had views of the Tower it didn't ruin the evening. The dry aged rib-eye with peppercorn sauce was delicious and the wife had the halibut, equally astounding. Service was stellar, staff was courteous, attentive and prices matched the quality of the dishes. Cheers to the staff for making my birthday one that I won't forget.

03CTPahwNsGoA5v8s3qsLw.text: This restaurant is quite nice and has amazing views of Tower Bridge so best place to sit is most certainly next to the window.  The food is British cuisine and was just ok nothing special.  Also I felt the staff was not very welcoming and quite standoffish which was off putting. However was a nice night out and had a lovely view to stare at whilst eating and enjoying the company of my friend but would I go back perhaps not just because I have had better British cuisine in other restaurants and the staff put me off.  However if you love British cuisine and would love a lovely view of Tower Bridge then I would say go along and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom

Upcd5kImkV-tFt7hZ_BQ5w.text: This place sits at an almost perfect location right next to Tower Bridge -- the view was fantastic, (the magikarps were plentiful), it was overall just a pleasant, lovely brunch experience for me.The food was tasty but nothing too fancy. I guess to a monster-everything-venti-everything-supersized North American, the portions seemed on the smallish side, but I do enjoy those days when I don't walk away from a table feeling like I just ate a truck. The service was quick and friendly, I would definitely visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful view

2GGGGl8ZbO1Afde9iqgp1A.text: Delicious food and excellent service. Great Easter meal  We had the "Red Roast pre fix" which was a nice sampling of different dishes like lamb, Yorkshire pudding and pork belly. Perfect for our first British meal.

Rx7CfQyq80iUnCrTNZ1RWA.text: Great food, great views, quality cocktails, easy to get to from the Tower, just a short walk across the bridge.  Can't beat the Evening Standard special.  Ask for Carmine, he'll take good care of you.

VfwKVmOsy6IRLHNqE9TaPw.text: Most disappointing dining experience during our London stay. Reservation for six made more than one week in advance yet we were assigned an unprepared table in the entry area which has no ambiance or sense of welcome. Waiter knew them menu well and offered good suggestions. It was overall very a la carte and plain. Beetroot & watercress salad was presented with endive replacing beetroot. Waiter acted as if we were the ones had got it wrong and made no apologies. Pea & mint soup (hot) was barely warm. Dinners were all just ok (steaks, cod, veg curry). Sticky pudding was best dessert, others were blah.This restaurant could do so much better. And until it does, diners can do much better at other options along the wharf.

EAWp_pReASRsXUBfnWk1gg.text: Disappointing. The food was good, not great. The service was terrible to the point I refused to pay the service gratuity on the bill. We waited for our drinks, waited for our appetizers. We had to ask about our entrees and it became apparent that the order had not been placed in the kitchen. We finally got our steaks and they were really nothing to rave about. We wanted desert, but waited so long to order that we decided to leave. Disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom

vfZ3tv3dL2m5cNdhK7i8ZA.text: I liked this place. It was classy, the views of Tower Bridge were nice, especially as we were there as the sun set and the service was good. The food was okay, pretty standard British cuisine. We decided to opt for the set menu with 2 courses coming in at £23.50 per person. To start with I had the pea and mint soup with smoked ham and then the fish and chips. The fish and chips were good, fairly standard, there was nothing to distinguish them from any other fish and chips I'd had in another restaurant. I've probably had better in a pub to be quite honest. I liked the soup and the ham was smoked and chunky and just delicious. We also had 3 bottles of wine (between 4 of us) and the waiters were very attentive when it came to filling our glasses up which was good. They also swapped the cutlery around according to what each person had ordered and remembered everyone's dishes when it came to serving which I thought was impressive. Overall a pleasant dining experience. Food was a bit generic though!

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Table setting
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Crusty bread and butter

_sIyVCdNnwx25dD3Hwk62Q.text: Food was ok - basic but good. The view is what made the dinner so great! Ate outside on the terrace and had a perfect view of the Tower Bridge at sunset. Waiter was very nice and service was at a good pace.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Dinner view from outside tables

_PO5m064tTaqWHk8pXOTzg.text: pea and wild garlic soup - very tasty but I thought the chicken stock (shop bought stock cubes is my guess) was slightly too overpowering.deep fried whitebait with mayonnaise - the whitebait was fried in a lightly spiced batter, but was overly oily. It was however served with a delicious tartare sauce.sausage rollsalmon fishcake with devilled mayonnaise - the fishcakes were slightly dry and the salad looks like a slapdash work. The crab meat in the mayonnaise was ace and I wish there were slightly more of it!steak sandwich - I wasn't asked how I like my steak, but fortunately it was not over done. The meat was good and tender so I enjoyed the sandwich, but the crisps that were served with it were so oily and over-salted as to be almost up there in the cholesterol league with deep-fried mars bars!, It also gave the impression that it was a cheap bag from the supermarket.sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice-creamfish platter GBP 13.50

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. fishcake
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. steak sandwhich

zemEF6LbEp3c2UXdOe_SvA.text: This place is one of several restaurants along the waterfront along the Thames river just east of the Tower Bridge.They have several outdoor seating so if you get here early enough you can secure your spot here so too can get a good view of the Tower Bridge. The view of the Thames river, well, not so much. It's quite polluted from my point of view.I came for the pre-fixe lunch menu, 3 courses for £22. I started off with the salmon. Nice, fresh, very vibrant color. It came with half a lemon to give it a great tangy flavor. It also came with some potato salad. I wasn't a fan of it. It really didn't compliment the salmon.For the main course, I ordered the pork chops. I figured that since this place is a chop house that the most logical sense was to get the pork chops. Not in this case. Very hard, and dry. And not at all tasteful. The applesauce was decent though.And for dessert, I went with their sticky toffee cake. Nice, warm and sticky. The cake was a bit dry, but my views of the Tower Bridge and the walkers and runners right next to me kept me entertained enough to get through this dry cake.I also enjoyed my views with a nice cold Cotswold premium lager.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding, clotted cream and toffee sauce
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Pork chop, roasted tomato, grilled mushrooms, Bramley apple
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon, potato salad, rye bread

hNw2Exf91OKFK7Y24fXwLg.text: First proper meal in the UK for me while visiting a while back, and it set the bar high. Probably my most memorable meal on my entire Europe trip.Set on the Thames right by London Tower Bridge, BWCH has got a great view for sure. In fact, I absolutely LOVE the wharf area (was staying at the Guoman Hotel across the river) for its industrial feel. The interior is decked with wood, and I love the airiness and it gives to the space. Had a late dinner with the family, starting about 830ish. We sat outside on the patio area, and it was just amazing. Our servers were courteous and helped us through the menu, which was nice especially since we were being touristy. The sister and I both opted for the Best of British menu (a great value at ~25 pound for 3 courses). We went for sweetbreads, fish & chips, pork chop, strawberries & cream, and grapefruit jelly with elderflower sorbet. Amazing. The pork had a perfect crackling  as well. Mmm. Parents went for a steak and a salad, both pretty good, nothing ridiculously exceptional. Really, the standouts were the sweetbreads and the elderflower dessert. The sweetbreads were nicely fried up and creamy on the inside - just seasoned enough as well. The elderflower sorbet was so fragrant, and everyone enjoyed that one.BWCH is definitely a bit pricier as a dinner option, so it's good for special occasions or for a truly nice night out. I'd highly encourage outdoor seating along the river if it's a great summer night, and go for a time that'll get you ending around 930-10. That's when the view of the river and London Tower Bridge from the restaurant is really spectacular.Will be back here on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. simple and fresh berries and cream
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. grapefruit jelly with elderflower sorbet
Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. just look at that sunset view

EzxCk2ztOZQ1hERAFgD93Q.text: Unfortunately, this restaurant does not have the best service. The food was amazingly delicious however the beverage service lacks attention and friendly service. Our server was excellent but the rest of the staff was not friendly at ALL for the price of the meal. Very sad when a place has a fillet to die for. I guess you have to trade GREAT service for excellent steak. What a pity! We were treated like horrible tourists who only ordered one entree and split amongst 4 people. Our bill was well over £200....

BMr_sPsXYY0qwSPNy9firw.text: Caution tourists! They tried to charge us €37.00 for a bottle of wine listed as €19.00 on the menu the view is beautiful, but they try to take advantage of the foreigners. Review your bill carefully

tbu7hKRFqeYnfpy_6pyyAA.text: The view of the Tower Bridge is great but otherwise nothing to shout about. The oysters were nice and briny but poorly-shucked; there were pieces of broken shell in the oysters. The temperature of the steaks seemed off. Or maybe it's just different standards in different countries. In any case I ordered a medium sirloin but it came well-done. The sides - roasted potatoes and buttered carrots - were rather bland. Oh, and the service was at best gruff.

photos.caption: Photo of Butlers Wharf Chop House - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin steak

Y38-GuJ-m8AfmKPlYnjW_Q.text: I must have first visited this place over 15 years ago and have been back regularly since.It has declined. What a shame.The place itself is looking a bit shabby, the food was pretty good but nothing special, the drinks were over-priced and the service.......oh dear...it was a shambles. They need to sort this out - there are way more excellent restaurants in London than when they first opened - so why would you go here any more when it's like this?

pLmnSigu0-dIyCd79tfdTQ.text: Total fail at the chophouse tonight. Lost an order, and over 20 minutes to fix the problem. Way too long to come up with a roast chicken.  Completely unimpressed with service.

NV21rlieU2Y5RYknYRMCLA.text: Great view of Tower Bridge London. Thursday night spexeial two wasy for 18.95 Pounds Sterling.Deliciois preparation.

E6glDAqXPYl7qwH2S-W6lg.text: The restaurant is beautiful and has a great view of the bridge. The food was beyond delicious. But...The service was sadly lacking. Some members of the staff were very rude and off putting and treated us like dumb tourists. Mind you we ordered a bottle of wine, 3 apps and 4 steak entrées. The attention to detail was very poor and our poor server had 9 tables all to herself with little help from her peers. The Sommelier was extremely bored and not attentive at all. We aren't just some tourists who don't know anything, our entire group works in the tourism industry for a very large company so we know customer service and there was no customer service. Raquel, our server, was the wonderful.

hjCDRdJAqgHUeeaHtJPUwA.text: I went back this evening with a couple of friends after a gap of about 3 years since my last visit. It was just as good as I remember - lovely service, fantastic  view and wonderful food. At the moment they are doing a really good festive deal - three courses from a set menu for 27.50. I had the game terrine, the roast turkey and then the plum pudding with brandy custard. The game terrine was ok, a little dry and I could have done with some chutney, but very pleasant. The turkey itself was a reformed slice that was a bit odd, but the rest of the plate was divine. The bacon wrapped sausage was outstanding and the brussels were luuuuuverly! But, and here the best was definitely saved until last... the plum pudding in brandy custard was probably the most outstanding dessert that I have ever had. Ever! Wow, that was good - hot, warming, alcoholic, just perfection!
